Key Arguments: Existing laws already protect people from harm, making the new legislation unnecessary.
The bill could allow the government to control information flow and suppress opposition, threatening democracy.
Freedom of speech is crucial for societal progress and should not be restricted.
All information, even if disagreeable, contributes to a balanced view.
The bill contradicts the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, specifically Article 19.
Notable Quotes: This Bill enables any government at any time to control the flow of information.
Freedom of speech, regardless of its content, is important for a free functioning society.
All information is good, even that which you reject, as it allows for a balanced view.
